intro: Calcaratolobelia cordifolia, commonly known as the heartleaf calcaratolobelia, is a rare flowering plant native to the wetlands of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lobeliaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and delicate blue-violet flowers. The plant typically grows in shallow, nutrient-rich waters and thrives in humid, tropical climates. Its roots are often submerged, and it plays a role in stabilizing aquatic ecosystems. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
